ratings.comment: I agree with the other reviews, Edmonds is not able to disagree without mocking students and does create a somewhat hostile class environment. This makes it rough to make any dissenting argument unless you have thick skin

Good books, decent lectures, very engaging discussions and films. Participation is a must!!! I learned a lot and my writing improved. Edmonds gives good feedback and context and she's funny. Fairly easy A.

Rather than fostering open discussions, Dr. Edmonds shut down and openly mocked students ideas with which she didn't agree. The stress caused by this class was not worth anything I may have otherwise taken away from it. Her feedback on essays was inconsistent and unclear, even when I went to office hours.

Dr. Edmonds was great. A bit intimidating at the beginning of the semester. She'll challenge you to develop and polish your arguments, but her grading could be much stricter and still fair. You do have to read and some of it is challenging but she'll help you digest it. Available for office hours. She's also hilarious and immensely knowledgeable.

I LOVE LITERATURE AND THIS CLASS IS HELL.She claims that the class reflects the students participation but we participated a lot and we still got scolded daily. Any opinion or thought you share she will invalidate by mocking you. She claims that this is just what college is-false-my other professors are so much better. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS PLZ!!!

Dr. Edmonds is very knowledgable about the content. She goes over exactly what happens in the chapters you were supposed to read. She gets frustrated when nobody participates and makes comments to the TA frequently to talk to us about that. She is a tough grader, especially when she knew our class was mostly all taking it for the ethnicity credit.
Edmonds is a mixed bag, class was always different which I mostly liked. Doesn't always lecture. Some really good discussions, some not so good. Interesting readings. Overall, solid experience.

Class isn't difficult but do the reading to follow class conversations.  It's worth it because Prof challenges you to think about issues from different perspectives and back up your ideas.  She's funny, straightforward, invested in her field, gives good feedback.  Ignore the haters.  Great class for critical thinking about race and American culture

Professor Edmonds was a very interesting lecturer and had 2 extra-credit opportunities during the semester which are few and far between at UW-Madison. Lectures were fairly interesting, and Prof. Edmonds' personality made the class even more enjoyable.

Prof. Edmonds loves to hear the sound of her own voice. She doesn't allow for anyone's opinions in the class besides her own. The content of the class was interested but was never applied in class. I couldn't tell you a single thing I learned even tho i love english. I fully regret taking this class.

I genuinely enjoyed taking Dr. Edmonds's class. She is extremely intelligent, funny, and doesn't assign a ridiculous amount of reading. One of my biggest take away from this class is how it changed my perceptions and discourse around black lives and black experiences. If you're looking for an intellectually challenging course, consider her class.

Dr. Edmonds is very knowledgeable and encourages good discussions. She has relatively high standards and challenges her students but is also open to criticism and is flexible with students' needs. She can be blunt at times so she's defiantly not for everyone but once you get her vibe she is quite enjoyable and funny.

Professor Edmonds provides many additional opportunities for success for her students and ensures students understand course material before essays and exams. I recommend this class for those looking for an intellectually challenging class and an open discussion.

Edmonds was a fun professor to have. She has a fun, dry sense of humor which made her class one of my favorites freshman year. Her feedback is pretty honest, so if you can't handle criticism she's probably not for you. She listens to student's feedback about tests. Make sure to complete the readings or you won't know what's going on.

I liked Edmonds, but I can see how she's not for everyone....Funny, controversial, very willing to challenge student opinions. I learned a lot and class was always interesting. Recommend her humor classes

Tbh I didn't like Edmonds much at the start but she really grew on me throughout the semester. She's passionate ab what she teaches but can be forceful & pushy w/ her opinions often. The class was very engaging & all the material we went over was interesting & opened my perspective on many topics. Don't take it if ur easily offended tho..

Edmonds is just unnecessarily rude all the time. She gets mad when people don't participate even when she doesn't give you a chance to in the first place. She's passionate about the books, but she is very set in her opinions about them so it is hard to gain anything from the class because of that.

Edmonds made clear nearly every class that she did not want to be there. Some days there would be really great discussions and you'd find yourself finally connecting with her, but then there were days she was combative and got angry for no reason. Overall, she felt above teaching an introductory course and had very limited views about our ideas.

I initially had high hopes for Edmonds, but she made the course a little unbearable. Sometimes we had great discussions, but she had a habit of scolding the whole room, which made things tense and uncomfortable most of the time. The work is manageable but disorganized. She's not a harsh grader. Overall, she doesn't seem to care for her students :/

Prof. Edmonds is a pretty average teacher. The one thing I didn't like about her teaching style was that she would often dismiss or counter arguments that students would make about the readings. LOTS of reading in this class but generally the books are interesting. Takes attendance.

She is the rudest professor I have ever heard of. She scolds classes like youre in elementary school and will personally victimize you if you dont participate in class. She also hates the internet so keep that in mind. Try to avoid her classes if possible.
